channel.title: AMC Movie Talk (Audio Edition)
channel.description: A daily video and audio podcast talking about and debating the bigest movies and movie news of the week. Hosted by AMC Movie News Senior Editor John Campea who is joined each episode by some of the leading voices in the online film world. Movie talk for movie fans.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - THE MASK Sequel Chances, New BOND Villain
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday August 17th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Jamal Witherston writes: What’s up AMC! Love the shows you guys do. Quick question for ya. I notice on AMC Movie Talk you guys go through topics pretty fast, like 2-3 minutes each. On Mail Bag you kinda take your time and elaborate more and the shows can go 45 minutes to an hour. Why not take your time on Movie Talk like you do on Mail Bag?

 

M.A.K. writes: Hi, amc movie talkers love the show , haven't missed an episode. John, you're da man! My question is about  the  DC shared universe. John said earlier in the show that the best step for WB/DC is to do a justice league and then do individual movies. But i'm wondering , isn't that going to be a problem? After justice league they have to do an origin story for each character, and that's going to feel like a step back because they will feel like prequels, no one is forcing WB/DC to do it but the fans want to see an origin story for wonder woman, flash, cyborg, aquaman, ect, because it's never been done before.

 

Josh Deaton writes: I just wanted to know your thoughts on the trailer for Jake Gyllenhaal's new movie Nightcrawler. The trailer slipped through the cracks because of its release around comic con, but for me this trailer made this one of my most anticipated movies.

 

Mat writes: Hello amc. Marvel is taking chances on antman and gotg. That great but what about the one thing marvel has yet to take a chance on. A female hero movie! Marvel comic fans have complained for years about few female hero comics and it's spread to movies and tv. So far they have done a great job with black widow and Wanda might be great but the real test is if marvel wants to take a chance give us a female hero movie! Marvel has tons of female heroes to use! Will we ever get a female lead marvel movie like black widow, ms marvel, Rescue, she-hulk, wasp, or tigra?

 

Shervin writes: Hi AMC, Love the show and haven't missed an episode since I found you. My question is about the Transformers franchise. Due to the fact that Transformers movies keep on getting worse and they get a lot of hate and awful reviews, how come they do so well in the box office, specially  the 3rd and 4th installment that have both earned more than a billion dollars worldwide?! Thanks and bring on the filthy.

 

Jamison Plakon writes: Hi I love the show. On recent mailbag john got in a question about should they re release star wars in theatres before episode 7 comes out. My question is werent they gonna re release all of them even the prequels in 3D i know they stopped once the news of the new episodes coming out happened but do you think they should put them out in 3D if they still choose to re release them? also if they stopped with releasing those why do you think they would want to re release them again?

 

Arturo Ortiz writes: Hola, AMC! I look forward to the show everyday! My question is: With the news and buzz about the new Dumber and Dumber To movie, it really got me thinking about another comedy franchise that Jim Carrey plays a huge part in: The Mask. Is there ANY chance they'll consider making the Mask 3 and completely ignore the disaster that was Son of the Mask? Or do you think they'll reboot the franchise sometime in the near future? Thanks and keep doing what you do best!

 

Kyle Beckwith writes: John and company have discussed this year potentially being the greatest year for comic book movies. While I agree this year has certainly delivered, I feel it can't be called a truly great year for comic book films because the juggernaut that is WB didn't release anything. I believe that 2016 will take the crown of best comic book movie year. Captain America 3, the other Marvel property (possibly Dr. Strange), Xmen: Apocalypse, Sinister Six (good or bad is a very important film for Sony), and Batman v Superman (enough said). What do you all think?

 

Freddie Fullerton writes Hi AMC, James Bond filming is set to start later this year with cast releases set to happen soon. There have been rumours that Chiwetel Ejiofor has been set to play the villain. Do you think he would make a good Bond villain and who would you like to see take on the Bond villain role in the future. Thanks and keep up the good work.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Does STAR WARS Even Need A Trailer?
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday Auguest 16th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Jesse Vargas writes: Hey AMC, love the show and never miss an episode. My question is about Edge of Tomorrow, do you think it's a good idea for Warner Bros. to change the title to Live. Die. Repeat. before it's released on DVD and Blu-Ray later this year? Personally, I think the studio should have stayed with its original title, All You Need is Kill. Thanks and keep up with the good work.

 

Justin Knapich writes: Hey guys and gals of AMC. Long time fan from way back. First I want to say thank you for being part of my daily routine. Anyway.. Since Star Wars VII is coming into theaters, do you think they will re-release the originals in the theaters (IV,V,VI) I would think it would be great for the people that never experienced them and also for the ones that have. On top of most likely bringing in some great money.  What do you guys think?

 

Jason I writes: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I remember John saying that he considers two of the top three male acting performances to be Daniel Day Lewis in There Will Be Blood and Colin Firth in the King's Speech. My question is, what about the third actor?

 

Hi AMC movie crew, I love your show. Godzilla 2014 was my favorite summer movie this year and I am more than happy that it is getting a trilogy. I just recently heard that Godzilla 2 just got a release date on June 8, 2018. My question is: Do you guys think that the relatively weak word-of-mouth which caused the movie to plummet over 66% at the box office in its second weekend?

 

Ben Godec writes: Hey everybody. Love me or hate me for this, but I was thinking for either Star Wars or Batman / Superman if they didn't release any trailers or footage, would they still make roughly the same amount of money? Even if you did a teaser or something with font saying "Be Ready" because lets face it, we are. What if they publicized it differently? Could it be a game changer for marketing?  Why not do it?

 

Jonathan Bell writes: Hey guys! If Expendables 3 doesn't do as good as even the second, could this be the end of the series?

 

Kevin Serrano writes: Hi everyone! This show is awesome!! I've been watching it for over three months now (very addicting). I've been thinking, how would a Justice League film be if Christopher Nolan directed it? And which legendary directors (Alfred Hitchcock, Martin Scorsese, Stanley Kubrick, David Lynch etc.) would you have liked to helm a super hero film? Thank you and keep bringing the goods!

 

Jimmy Bender writes: Hey Guys and Gals at AMC, I love your show! One of the things that I love about your show is that you show a true passion and joy about movies. You may have movies you dislike, but you can really tell you love movies and convey that in your show. Unfortunately, that seems to be rare now. I listened to another movie review show and it seemed like he talked more about movies that he felt were awful more than any movie he enjoyed. Do you feel that there is more negativity in the media now when talking about movies?

 

Sean Halon writes: Hi guys,  love the show, can't get enough! My question regards the upcoming film Serena, staring Jennifer Lawrence and Bradley Cooper.  The film is due to be released here in the UK on October 24th but there is no trailer or advertisement for this film whatsoever. Shouldn't there be some sort of advertising by now? I don't want to sound negative but does this mean bad things for the film in terms of the studios belief in it? I loved the chemistry of these two in Silver Linings Playbook and can't wait to see them work together again! 

 

Nicolas writes: Greetings and salutations amc movie talk crew, my question is what is the next "Star Wars" in terms of nostalgia, is guardians in 10 or 20 years going to be considered one of the greats in sci-fi? Thanks and keep it up!

 

Joe Hogan writes: Hey guys love the show! I was just wondering with the passing of Robin Williams could we see a autobiography movie of his life of how he started, his ups and downs, and how it ended? Possibly sometime in the near future. Thanks and keep up the good work!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Chris Pratt As Indiana Jones? Is 48FPS Good Or Bad?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday August 10th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Nathan Swaza writes: Hey AMC Movie Talk, I love the show and get up every morning to watch it. My question is: Did you like 'The Hobbit' in 48 FPS and what do you think of the rumors saying 'Star Wars: Episode VII" will be done in 48 FPS? Personally, I think it's an awful idea, and the 48 takes you out of the movie. Thanks, and bring on the filthy.

 

Abdo Esper writes: Hey guys, greetings from Mexico! Its so weird that I don't even know you guys, and yet you've become a part of my life. Anyway, Sometimes when a movie comes out it is met with mixed or negative reviews, it is only within the passing of time that people really begin noticing how good it really is, just like with Citizen Kane or Singin' in the rain. Do you think the Oscars should give awards to movies ten years after they've came out. In that way you can hand the oscar to the movies that really stand the test of time and prevent anymore mistakes from being made.

 

BarinderPal Nanuan writes: Hey guys love the show, did anyone notice that FINDING DORY and HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON 3 are coming out on the same day (July 17, 2016). I'm pretty sure that one of them is gonna end up changing the date and I believe its gonna be HTTYD3. Do u guys think that one of them will change the date and which one. Keep up the good work.

 

Kevin Chico writes: Hi amc , my question is who going to win a Oscar first Joseph Gordon Levitt or Tom hardy. I think these two are upcoming movie stars and are two of of my favorite actors. Your thoughts?

 

Jake Berlin writes: Hey AMC Crew, can't get enough of the show. So yesterday I'm roaming through my instagram feed and saw your very own Kristian Harloff post a picture of Chris Pratt in a Indiana Jones get up. Now I instantly fell in love with the idea, it just never crossed my mind. With the talks of the Indy franchise possibly doing the 'James Bond treatment', is there anyone out there who could fit the role better than Chris Pratt now that we saw his overall skills in Guardians? 

 

George Daviz writes: Hey guys love the show! My question is about movie bombs, what happens to the wages for all the peopel who worked on the film? Like if a actor is working on a big budget movie and it horribly bombs would their pay for the movie get cut down?

 

Joe Jones writes: Hello AMC Crew, Love the show, Due to BvS moving it's date to March 25. Dose that mean BvS Won't get as much money now, Because it's not in the summer! Anyways just wanted to know your answer!

 

Bradly Miller writes: Hello everyone at AMC movie talk, thanks for the awesome show. I was wondering if you have ever thought of making a International movie show like AMC movie talk. One that helps inform more people on great international films. I remember my dad showing me a Bruce Lee film when i was younger. I was hooked, it helped me to learn about other cultural and the world i live in. I now have a great love and appreciation for foreign films. Your show has done a similar thing, informing me to epic new films and ways to look at them. Just though the AMC family would do it justice. Thanks again for your time, keep up the astounding work.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Too Many Superhero Movies?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday August 9th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

James Walsh writes: hello amc and keep up the fine work. my question is about the amount of superhero films coming out from 2015 to 2020. with dc announcing they plan to release 9 and marvel averaging 2 movies a years that's 19 movies. then you got to factor in sony and fox who are releasing 1 to 2 movies a year as well. so over the next 5 years we could be getting close to 30 plus superhero movies. my question is do you think that this amount of comic book movies over a short space of time will oversaturate the market leading to some big box office bombs? or do you think it is insignificant?

Evan Lee writes: Hey guys. Love the show. My question is about Chris Pratt. After the success of Guardians of the Galaxy and the fact that Pratt's also going to be in Jurassic World, do you think there's any chance he could be the next huge action star? He clearly has the body for it now, and I think he has the ability (acting, comedic timing, charisma). What do you guys think?

Joe Vang writes: Hello AMC, how come no one is talking about the Dawn of the Planet of the Apes box office results? It has only made 400 million worldwide while its previous predecessor made the same number. Compared to a movie like X-Men DOFP, their budget was about the same but X-Men did drastically better with 700 million. Thoughts?

Luis Fonseca writes: Hello amc crew love you guys and the show. Can the incredibles 2 beat frozen for the highest gross animated movie i think it has a chance at it what do you guys think?

Andre Vila Franca writes: Will you ever gonna talk about anime or manga? Because there are tons of amazing  and beautifully written and drawn stories that could be adapted to cinema such as BERSERK by Miura Kentaro. If the producers got the courage to adapt such fenomenal manga to cinema i believe without a doubt that the Hollywood directors would pay much more attention and respect to manga and anime and would start to make a lot more of these adaptations.

Miguel Batacan writes: Hello All! Love the show and cant get enough of it! For months now John and others have Been Saying Batman V Superman "Needs" to be a gigantic hit. While I don't Disagree, How much of a hit are we talking about? Are we talking A massive financial hit? if so How big? Are we talking A critically acclaimed hit? Are we talking Both? And with all the controversy over their decisions, can they Realistically expect it to be as colossal a hit as your saying?

Blake Skinner writes: Good day sons and daughters of AMC! Love the show! My childhood was filled with more mature films rather than children films. My favorite movie's of all time are Point Break, Face Off, and the SAW Franchise. My question is with remakes, and reboots becoming a big thing. If you had to choose, would you rather see a remake, or reboot of Point Break, or Face Off?

Adam B writes: I was watching In Bruges with Colin Farrell the other day and forgot how much I really love this movie. I remember there was some oscar buzz for his performance after it came but he never was nominated (same goes for him in Saving Mr Banks). Anyways, what is your favorite performance that in your opinion should've been nominated, but never was? Thanks and bring on the filthy!

Garry Hasara writes: What is up with "Kingsman: The Secret Service" moving from later in 2014 to Feb 2015? Is that a bad sign that the movie isn't testing well?  Seems like a "Jupiter Ascending" desperate move.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Where Does The MCU Go After Thanos?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday August 3rd 2014) we take the following viewer email questions:

 

 

Lathe Magnusson writes: HUGE fan of the show I started watching it back in August 2013 and I was wondering do you think they will make a kick ass 3?

 

Nick Parker writes: Nick writes: Greetings everyone my question is about Thanos and his place going forward in the MCU. Everyone says oh Thanos will be the big bad in Avengers 3. But I thought I remember somewhere Feige saying Thanos was a kind of endgame if you will. Do you think we could get a few more Avengers films before the mad Titan comes to earth? Because who poses a bigger threat than Thanos? How do you up the ante after that?

 

Cameren Ceniceros writes: Hey guys! Love the show! I heard you guys talk about when the first trailer might show up for Star Wars episode 7, some say at the Star Wars celebration and some say at next years comic con, my theory since Star Wars is owned by Disney, it will debut infront of Avengers Age of Ultron, what do you guys think?

 

KJ Greene writes: You guys have an a very informative show and I love to watch it everyday. Hope you guys enjoyed Comic Con and my question is about the Marvel panel. I wanted to know if Fox could taking legal action against Marvel because of Elizabeth Olsen's incident of slipping up and calling her character the M word (mutant)? Thanks and keep bringing the filthy.

 

Marc Charette writes: There has been a lot of discussion amongst fans of Deapool needing to be a hard R for it to work.  I saw a comment on a forum yesterday which leads me to think PG-13 could, if written into the script would actually work for Deadpool.  PG-13 you're not allowed a bunch of blood, or the use of more then one swear word.  The comment i saw talked about letting Deadpool swear, but beeping it out, and having Deadpool make reference to the beeps and lack of blood to the audience.

 

Cameren Ceniceros writes: Hey AMC, Love the Show! My question is regarding the future of the DC universe, if we see them get more established over time could we see the Injustice gods among us story brought to the big screen? Thanks and bring on the filthy!

 

Osa Okojie writes: I was excited about the assassins creed movie until Michael fassbender left because the studio was not fateful to the story does this mean we will have another failed videogame movie.

 

Kevin Chico writes: Kevin Chico writes: hi amc movie talk i been watching long before the mos review. I just finished watching district 9 and was wondering if there's ever going to be a sequel to this movie. I think the ending leaves it to a sequel. Love to hear your thoughts.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - BATMAN v SUPERMAN Does It Matter Who Is Taller?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday August 2nd 2014) we address the following viewer emails:

 

 

Nick Denbow writes: Hey guys! Love the show and watch everyday. I was wondering what you guys think are the most underrated animated films. I think Oliver & Company, The Emperor's New Groove, and Robots are the most underrated. Thanks!

 

Jesus Martinez writes: Hey guys, love the show. I was wondering if other members of the justice league will get their own score such as Hans Zimmer's  man of steel? And what will happen to superman's score?

 

Jason I writes: Hey AMC Movie Talk crew! I love your show. I was just wondering what you guys thought about footage or trailers that are only shown at Comic Con panels and then never shown again. I personally hate it because it deprives most of the fans from ever witnessing something from a film that they are huge fans of. I also think many diehard fans have legitimate reasons for not being able to make it out to Comic Con and they are not any less loyal than the fans at the panel.

 

Kyle Carragher writes: Hey AMC movie crew, love the show. I re watched one of my favourite Disney animation films the other day, Lilo and Stitch. I loved that film when it came out but I was disappointed by the straight-to-dvd sequels. Will we ever see that franchise visited again?

 

Zachery Merrell  writes: After watching the abysmal Boondock Saints sequel, a thought popped in my head: Is it better to have an attempt at making a good sequel or to leave certain movies as a stand alone film? Some of these films have horrible sequels and some are wanted by fans. So, putting hindsight aside, is it better to have the filmmakers try and fail (again Boondock Saints 2) or to not have one at all (unfortunately True Lies)? Thanks and keep bringing that sweet dirty filthy!

 

Liam Tobin writes: Hey guys, love the show! Would you like to see Kate Beckinsale return as Selina in the Underworld franchise? I thought she did an amazing job and undoubtedly owns that character, and I enjoyed all the Underworld films so I would love to see more. Also I would like to know which of the four films is your favourite and why?

 

Elliot Cain writes: Hey guys, love the show! Quick question, before Jesse Eisenberg was cast as Lex Luthor in Batman V Superman, there was lots of talk about Bryan Cranston becoming the next Luthor. How would you feel if he was cast as James Gordon?

 

Anthony Lopez writes: So I saw some footage from the DC Comic-Con panel.  Ben Affleck came out, Henry Cavill followed, and I was personally shocked by how much taller 'Batman' was than 'Superman'.  I never realized how whoppingly tall Affleck was untill I saw the two of them next to each other.  However, in all depictions of these fictional characters, Superman is "just a little bit" taller than Batman.  How do you think they will handle this in the upcoming movie?  Do you think they will put in the extra effort to make Superman appear taller than Batman, or will they just let it ride like it is?

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Short Guardians Of The Galaxy Review? Where Is The Zelda Movie?
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday July 19th 2014) we take the following viewer questions:

 

 

Tony Camara writes: AMC Movie News crew I was wondering what your thoughts on general critics and the average movie viewer.  There are certain movies when I watch I go into the movie thinking I want to be entertained and have fun watching it like "popcorn movie".  I guess what I'm getting at is it bothers me that sometimes people critique certain movies for their plot, acting, or whether it's realistic or not  when watching for example any Expendables or Fast and Furious. I mean when I go see these movies I'm expecting great action and funny one liners.  I'm not analyzing the same way I would The Godfather, Shawshank Redemption, Argo, etc... I mean as a viewer you should know what kind of movie it is and judge accordingly, right?

 

Jonathan Gray writes: Hey Movie Talk crew!  I only stumbled upon your show about a month ago, but I've been instantly hooked. My question is with George R. R. Martin publicly stating he'd like to see his A Song Of Fire and Ice series end in a movie what studio would you like to see get the rights and who do u think would make the best director for the challenging job? Thanks and bring on the filthy.

 

Bill Crisby writes: Hi AMC Crew, your show rocks every single day and I am greatfull to see you every day. My Question for today is the thing that John mentioned early this year that he think's if Episode VII is a great movie than maybe Episode VIII could be the most successful movie of all time. What does that mean for the Avengers sequel? Do you think Age of Ultron has the chance to be even more successful than the beloved first Avenger movie?

 

 

Chris Smith writes: Dear AMCMovieTalk, Love the show best wishes for the Geekie award. Would you say Emilio Estevez has fallen off the radar? And is there any possibility of him rejuvenating his career like Breakfast Club Co-star Molly Ringwald (Staring in Jem adaptation) ? 

 

Louis Lau writes: Hello AMC Movie Talk, You make my daily work so much more entertaining. My question is, are there any plans to make a great and epic police/crime-thriller similar to the Infernal Affairs trilogy? Unfortunately no The Departed 2, but any thing close to it coming out soon? 

 

Marc Denney writes: I'm a huge Christian Bale fan and own most of his films. I get excited for any movie he is in. I've always thought he should do a movie with Guy Ritchie and do a "Snatch" type movie or a "Rocknrolla" movie. I think it would be interesting because Guy Ritchie's films feature comedy and drama which I think would be a nice role for Bale to tackle. I also think it would be cool to have Bale use his actual accent. What do you guys think?

 

 

Ralph Terry writes: Hello AMC Movie Talk, the best show on the web. On a previous episode, you would asked who would win an Oscar first, Andy Serkis or Leonardo DiCaprio.  So to use a term that John would like, let's raise the stakes a bit. So it had me wondering, who do you think will win an Acting performance Oscar before a  Lifetime Achievement Oscar first, Leonardo DiCaprio or Tom Cruise?

 

Shane Barlow writes: Hey AMC crew, I recently heard that in the new Marvel Comics Sam Wilson (The Falcon) will be taking over for Steve Rogers as Captain America. Do you think there is a chance that in Phase 3 or 4 of the MCU, that Anthony Mackie's Sam Wilson could become Captain America? Personally I think it would be great, thanks for reading my question and keep up the great work.

 

 

Joe Vang writes: Hello AMC crew, what do you guys think of Stephen Chow's work? I really like his movies and would like to see him direct or even be in a North American movie. Thoughts?

 

 

Manii B writes: Thanks in advance crew if you answer this question, I'm an avid fan. My question is with Sony licensing out More of their video game properties  for  big screen adaptations and Warcraft currently filming, what are the chances of a "Legend of Zelda" movie being made? In my opinion it is the best fantasy game franchise and has possible LOTR potential.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Are Pixar Films For Adults Or Kids?
item.description:
Here's our Facebook page for our Comic-Con events. Check it out!  https://www.facebook.com/events/312071135630637/

 

On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday July 13th 2014) we take the following questions from our viewers!

 

 

Andrew Voigt writes: If Star Wars episode VII, Avengers 2 and Batman V Superman came out on the same day and you could only see one, which do you see? Thanks and keep up the good work.

 

 

Shawn Reynolds writes: Hi I was wondering why are just about all animated movies have a clear aim towards children?  Animated movies can explore mature themes just like live action. I know some animated movies have subtle themes that the adults will catch and the children won't initially, but I'm referring to a story puts a direct adult emphasis on such themes. Most of them feel relatively the same, going with a strong emphasis on comedy and sometimes some touching scenes. Are movie studios not putting these out because they feel that their connotation with being for children will guarantee failure at the box office?

 

 

Jonathan Bell writes: If Lucy does well at the box office, do you think that increases the chances of getting a Black Widow stand-alone?

 

 

Brandon Hamid writes: Hey amc you guys do the best show on youtube. I've heard details saying that at the end of days of future past Apocalypse was originally supposed to be introduced by combining with magneto at the end of the film possibly creating onslaught. Now they are saying that this could happen at the end of X Men Apocalypse. Thus could this set up a follow up film X Men Onslaught. So my question, is this a good idea (I think it is) and how likely is this to happen. Thanks Guys.

 

 

Jack Aman writes: Hi love the show and watch it every day. I have been really intrigued with Pixar's film The Inside Out since it was announced. The premise sounds amazing and even John said the 8 minutes he saw at cinamacon looked great on the show. So do you think come 2016 Oscar season this could finally be the first animation to win best picture? Thanks and bring on the filthy

 

 

HaMzA WaHiD writes: Hi guys, I'm an avid watcher of your show all the way from London and I appreciate your efforts. John recently said that Daniel Day lewis and Russel Crowe are the 2 best actors in the business and I  was wondering who your current top 5 actors are.

 

 

Javier Duran writes: Hi I love the show and Schnepp rocks! Well, I have always been a fan of former wwe wrestler Dave "The Animal" Bautista, so therefore I was wondering what you guys think of him as an actor? And will his role as Drax in Guardians open the doors for him as an actor?

 

 

Tanner Tran writes: Hello AMC! Big fan of the show, I've been watching your channel ever since you guys got the updated studio. My question is about one of my favorite shows and soon to be movie, Entourage. One of the big reasons why I liked it so much is that it had business portrayals and gave viewers how Hollywood works. My question is, how accurate is the movie industry portrayed in the show?

 

Dave Shrivastav writes: Hey Guys, Great show! I always watch/listen to it everyday. I won't be able to make it to ComicCon. Maybe one day! Are you guys going to record your panel and other things your doing during comic con?

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Should APES Or X-MEN Get Oscar Nominations?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday July 12th 2014) we take the following viewer questions:

 

 

Daniel Hoult writes: Hey AMC movies news guy my question is will fast and furious be the last one, Becasue looking at Facebook the cast have been posting like it's the last one they're doing?

 

 

Matt Van Winkle writes: Hey guys love the show! How do you think they're going to incorporate both future and past X-Men in Apocalypse?

 

 

Max Clark writes: Hi, When do you think Hugo Weaving's Red Skull will return, could he return in Guardians of the Galaxy?

 

 

Jessen A writes: First of all I really enjoy your show. I work in the industry and it great watching a film review show with people who know they stuff! I think Andy Serkis is amazing actor and his motion capture work is fantastic. Can't flaw his work.However, will Jar Jar Bink will get some recognition for its ground breaking in motion capture/CGI? And Ahmed Best for his work as Jar Jar?Keep up with the great work!

 

 

Thnx guys, for ur awesome show, I recently watched the complete firefly series along with serenity,  and I loved it and started hating the people who were responsible for its cancellation. My question is will it ever be relaunched by joss whedon again? Its in my view one of the best works of Joss Whedon, Thnx guys keep up the great work!!

 

Lewis Gibson writes: Hey AMC crew love the show. My question is regarding best picture, do you think X-men Days of Future Past and Dawn Of The Planet Of The Apes should be nominated for best picture and if they aren't would you be shocked? Thanks and keep up the good work.

 

 

Brian Bonardi writes: Hey guys love the show and watch it every chance I get.  You have all been saying how much Andy Serkis or other motion capture artists should be recognized by the academy for their performances and I am completely on board with that along side you.  But what about voice actors as well?  I'm not saying voice actors for just animated movies but also CG characters in live action movies as well.  For example, lets say Bradley Cooper gives his best performance yet playing Rocket Racoon in Guardians of the Galaxy, should the academy recognize that performance and include it in the acting category, or make a separate performance category?  What are your thoughts on this?

 

 

John-Eric Cervini writes: Hey guys and gals of AMC, love the show, my friends and I watch it every day together. With the Jurassic World being set 22 years after the first Jurassic Park, but still being a sequel, it got me to thinking about Superman Returns. Looking back at that film i always felt it was more of a sequel to the Christoper Reeve films than a movie all of its own.  Do you think if Warner Bros had promoted it more as a sequel to those films in the trailers and advertising before it ever came out, it would have been looked on more favorably by the audience than it was? Thanks and keep bringing on the filthy.

 

 

Ben Tevlin writes: Hey guys love the show been watching for over a year now and im still hooked. My question may seem strange but hear me out. With the news pf Ridley Scott planning on making another biblical film and with so many studios today having shared universes (marvel, dc, the conjuring ect) what would you think of.....wait for it.......A BIBLICAL SHARED UNIVERSE. Thanks and keep up the great work.

 

 

Jason Schlaman writes: Hey Guys, love the show. My question is: with Chris Pratt's career skyrocketing recently,  do you see him earning an oscar anytime in the near future? Thanks and bring on the filthy.

item.title: AMC Movie Talk - Can BATMAN V SUPERMAN Beat THE DARK KNIGHT?
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Movie Talk (Monday July 7th 2014) we talk all viewer questions including the following:

 

 

Brandon Pittman writes: Hey AMC Movie Talk Crew, You guys are the best. My question for you guys is: Which other genres or sub-genres do you think Horror can be "combined" with? To me I think I have seen great depictions of Scifi-Horror (Aliens, Prometheus), Superhero-Horror like Blade (In My Opinion), and from the recent film, Deliver Us From Evil, with Cops, Crime and demonic possessions mixed together in one film. What are your thoughts on mixing Horror with the rest of the movie genres? Can this be implemented in any type of film?

 

FX Only writes: Hi, love the show, I keep hearing on the show that comic book readers are a minority among movie goers.. I was also convinced by this but now I want to make a counter argument: Take a look at the Worldwide top grossing movies of 2014.. The top 3 are based on Marvel comics. Do you think that comic book readers are still a minority or this changed due to the raise of comic movie films in the recent years? Keep you the good work!

 

Christian Zada writes: Hi amc movie crew, love show and watch it everyday. This year we have been hearing a lot about comic book movies. And don't get me wrong i love them but what is your most anticipated Drama? Mine is Foxcatcher.

 

Sam Holden writes: Hi Amc I love the show watch every day! My question is can someone make a Norse God Thor movie  or one about the other mythical Norse Gods with out any of the marvel eliments in it and only follow the myths wth out them being aliens or are all the charecters copyrighted?

 

Gerald Tulao writes: Hello my filthy Dark Knights of the old AMC Republic! Love the show more than life itself. Pixars Ratatouille is not only my favorite Pixar film, not only is it my favorite animated film, it's my second all time favorite film (after Star Wars of course!)  My big concern is that Ratatouille will, and probably has already, become a forgotten Pixar film. I still always see products for other Pixar films such as Monsters, Wall-E and Nemo but nothing for Ratatouille! And I've had conversations where I mention the film and the other person would say "oh yea I forgot about that film". Am I just being paranoid?

 

Max Clark writes: Hi, how comes Tom Cruise hasn't been typecast as Ethan Hunt in the same way Daniel Radcliffe had been as Harry Potter?

 

Leo Berry writes: Hi guys, love the show and that you bring so much insight to all movie news. My question, do you think that Batman v Superman will do better at box office then the Dark Knight. Thanks and keep up the great work.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Are Stand Alone Superhero Films Finished? INTERSTELLAR
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday July 6th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

 

Brian Benjamin writes: What's good John ,I always end my day with amc movie news. awesome job on the show. Do you think the ufc will make a movie studio like WWE because of the rise of their superstar athletes like rhonda rousey, the iceman and GSP?

 

Alec Rappazzini writes: Hello my friends! I was just wondering when do you think we will get a trailer for the third Hobbit film, The Battle of the Five Armies? Here we are about 5 months out and we don't even have a teaser! I was one of those guys who poo-pooed The Desolation of Smaug because I wasn't a fan of the first Hobbit film. Then I saw Smaug and it became one of my top 10 films of 2013! I can't wait for Five Armies! 

 

 

Filip Orvik writes: Since Tony makes Ultron, can you see Ultron killing Tony in avengers 2?

 

 

Andrew Cianciolo writes: I really enjoy your podcast, I listen to it everyday. I have a question about Christopher Nolan's upcoming film, INTERSTELLAR. I was on IMDB on I saw that Jessica Chastain was listed as the the character "Murph", and actresses Mackenzie Foy and Ellen Burstyn were listed as "young Murph" and "old Murph". I find this odd because in the trailer, we clearly see that "Murph" is McConaughey's daughter in the film. If IMDB is correct, do you guys think we will see time travel in INTERSTELLAR? Why else would we see the character "Murph" age in the film?

 

 

Sam Hockney writes: Hey guys, love the show. I was wondering what do you think the chances are of there being a sequel to 2008's Wanted, with James McAvoy and Angelina Jolie? I noticed it made money and got decent reviews, could it possibly be the stars not wanting to do it? Thanks and keep brining the filthy!

 

Diakeim Lyles writes: Love the show and all that you guys do, gone are the days when shows like Entertainment tonight and even E! use to report actual movie news now it's just gossip. It was such a pleasure when I discovered your show during the man of steel release and now I NEVER miss a show, the movie dedication you guys have is AWESOME! Now my question... With all the new Star Wars movies coming, how long do you think John Williams will be the composer and do you think he'll do all the films including spin off's. Who do you think would be a good replacement? Bring on the filthy!

 

 

Doc Ervin writes: Hello AMC crew.  First, I love the show and have seen every episode on YouTube.  My question concerns this years Oscar for editing.  Since Gravity had several “long shots” of 6,8,10,12 and that awesome 17 minute opening scene, how in your opinion did it win for editing?  If nearly half the movie is continuous shots how is that better editing than a movie with quick cuts? thanks for your insight into movie making and keep up the great work. My day wouldn’t be the same without your show.

 

 

Michael LaGrange writes: Hello AMC love the show. I have been following since the Batman announcement at comic con last year. My question is I know Batman v Superman isn't coming out until 2016 but do you think there's a chance we'll get some kind of teaser clip at comic con this year? Maybe something simple like Bruce Wayne in the bat cave as Zod's message plays on the screens. Thanks and keep up the amazing work.

 

 

John Lutz writes: Hey AMC, I'm a big fan of your show - keep up all of your great work. My question is regarding John Krasinski as Captain America. As you probably know, he was almost cast and was one of Marvel's top choices. Do you think he would have been a good choice? And do you think he could still possibly be a superhero? Thanks.

 

Robb Underhill writes: Been watching for over a year now and thanks so much for helping to re-invigorate my love for the theatre experience.  Question is, do you feel we're at an end to stand "alone" superhero movies?  As much as I love seeing multiple heroes in one film and their interaction, I think Cap 1, Thor 1 (Hawkeye doesn't count) and Man of Steel are the end of that.  I just fear we'll miss that "one 'man' against it all" is all but gone, or will be. Thanks again and bring on that filthy!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Is Ben Affleck Too Old For BATMAN?
item.description:
On this episode of AMC mail Bag (Saturday July 5th 2014) we take the following viewer email questions:

 

 

Izzy Sanchez writes: Hello Sons of AMC. i love ur show i watch it all the time, i was supper excited the other day when u announced that Pacific Rim 2 is on the way. I love everthing Guillermo Del Toro has done with that said i am surprised that u have not mentioned his animated movie coming out soon called book of life . I saw the trailer to this a few days ago and it blew me away the story looks good. With as much love as is given to him on ur show I guess that is why i am shocked this has gone under the radar.

 

Jamal Pullium writes: Hi  AMC Movie Talk crew :) My question is, what is your favorite Tony Scott film?

 

Paul Hanson writes: Dear AMC Crew, I have been watching you for about a year now and have been very impressed with your honesty and opinions. Today July 4th is my 39th birthday. There will be no presents, cake or parties for me. Only a few Happy birthdays on Facebook and the possibility to take my 15 year old son to the movies. We saw DOFP and Winter Solder for his birthday earlier this year. So what movie currently playing would we both most likely enjoy? Thanks and bring on the Filthy.

 

Pavel Ryzhov writes: Thanks for your amazing work. My question is why people ask you to bring on the filthy?  And a movie related question is whether we will see Spider Man in a Sinister Six movie and if yes, to what extent?

 

 

Andrew Evans: Hello Amc! My Question Is, What Is Your Favorite Movie Scene Of All Time?

 

 

Nicholas Diaz writes: Hey sons and daughters of AMC! I Adore your show. My day would not be complete without you fine folks! Seeing the recent trend of top 5 questions. I would like to know. What your top 5 Spoof Movies?

 

Julien Cattan writes: Hey AMC crew, I love the show, I've been watching ever since the announcement of Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor and haven't missed an episode since. Keep up the great work! My question concerns the next Terminator movie: do you think that with its time travel mechanics it will compare to movies like X-Men : Days of Future Past, or Star Trek 2009? Is this idea of reboot through time travel becoming a trend in Hollywood? Could we give it an official name?

 

 

Hunter Smith writes: Greetings, since this Batman Superman movie is building up hype do you think a James Bond/Jason Bourne crossover movie could come out in the future?

Thanks and keep up the good work!

 

 

Luke Bryant writes: Hi AMC, love the show! My question is do you think the casting of Ben affleck as batman will back fire in the future when they want him to keep playing batman considering he's already 41 years old? He's only going to get older and he might become too old for the role. Love to hear your thoughts.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Who Are Marvel's Superman and Batman? Whose Fault Is Bad Movies?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday June 22nd 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Bruiz writes: Hello AMC Movie Crew, I''m a 49 year old USNavy Veteran and I love watching your show. My question is do any of you remember a movie a specific movie that your dad sat you down when you were little and said " This is the best movie ever " for example "Enter The Dragon" or "Highlander"  and you saw him popping that VHS tape at least once a week. If you did is it still a great movie to you?

 

James Walsh writes: Hey amc love the show. my question is about the recently announced 2016 remake of ben hur? what are your personal opinions of the movie reboot and how hard do you think its going to be for paramount of to remake such  an iconic  movie that so ingrained in Hollywood history?

 

Beau Carranza writes: Hello AMC Movie Talk Crew, you guys rock!  In my mind, the Jedi in Star Wars 7 will have to seem as if they can take on the Hulk.  What do you guys think?

 

Sean Hung writes: Hi AMC movie crew! I was wondering if you saw the new uk trailer for the drop and what you thought about it?

 

Gabe Grimes writes: Hey amc movie news love the show and can't get enough. In a previous episode John you said that you could not think of three undisputed kings of the Marvel comics, in my personal opinion I believe it is Captain America, Spider-Man, and Wolverine. Do you agree or do you have a different opinion of the big 3 in Marvel.

 

Samuel Tristan writes: Yooo guys n gallz, love your show, not missing an episode since MOS. I was wondering if you guys think that actors and directors who are watching your show ( i think a lot of them are ) will change their plans or visions based on the opinions of the AMC crew, because i feel like you are the main representatives of the movie going audience, and if so, how bad should Gal Gadot feel about her WW role :P

 

Mitchell Guerin writes: I want to know what your guys thoughts are on andrew stantons twitter posts on gods of mars and warlords of mars, saying big things would have led to even bigger things, but that it will never happen now , do you guys thunk it will ever happen because i belive we need more john carter movies, its so original and would be wrong to just shelf such a rich story and characters.

 

Kristian Schröder writes: Hi AMC movie talk. Love the show, you talked about the possibility of a R-Rated Marvel Universe with content like The Punisher. What are the chances of Blade getting a sequel with Wesley Snipes or being rebooted without him? And would you like to see a new Blade movie?

 

Kent Sandow writes: Hi AMC Movie Talkers! I have a question about horrible movies. I recently had the unpleasant experience in watching Battlefield Earth. While I was watching all I could think about was 'who's fault is this?' Do actors not look a scripts and say "Wow... that's bad" and stay away from it? Or is it just for the paycheck? But if it's for the paycheck and the movie is horrible, doesn't that actually hurt their potential to make more money in the future? Can't the director take a 20 minute unpolished look and say "ya... this isn't good.."  and require re-shoots, or rewriting of the script? I guess the real question is: Who's fault is it? Thanks, and bring on the filthy!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Prefer Jackman As WOLVERINE Or Downey As IRON MAN?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday June 15th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Daniel Glecier writes: Hey guys love the show and keep up the great work. I am a big fan of the film Starsky and Hutch, and I think its hilarious. Do you guys think that its possible we could see a sequel since they have done it with Dumb and Dumber To and Anchorman 2. Keep up the great work and bring on the filthy.

 

Christian Zada writes: Christian Zada writes: Hi AMC Movie Talk I have been watching your show for about a year now and was wondering if you had a gun to your head and had to choose if Hugh Jackman reprised his role as wolverine or if RDJ returns as iron man which one would you choose?

 

Skaj Cere writes: Hey everyone, hope you're having an awesome day. My question is; do you think we could see a post-credit scene in episode VII? And would you want one?

 

Steven Anthony writes: Hi my name is Steve Anthony fan of the show, watch everyday. I wanted to ask will we see a live action family guy movie. Thanks and keep up the good work.

 

Alan Heanue writes: Hey guys love da show just a quick one do u think Ashton Kutcher will ever get back into a big role cheers

 

Matt Santiago writes: Hey guys, Love the show. I have a question about marketing films. I've noticed that the marketing for The Amazing Spiderman 2 and Edge of Tomorrow were terrible. my question is what is the recipe to marketing a film perfectly? Examples would be nice too. Thanks. Keep up the great work. 

 

Peter Moorhouse writes: Hey guys, I love this show so much! You recently answered a question about Ferrell and Carell hosting the Oscars. It got me thinking that Foxcatcher is coming out at the end of the year and Carell could be a candidate for a Best Actor or Best Supporting Actor Oscar nomination. My question is has a host ever received an Oscar? And do you think it would be awkward? Thanks so much! and keep doing what you're doing!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Comparing Marvel To Star Wars And Feige To Lucas
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday June 14th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Nick Sergi writes: Hi.. I love the show. However, I find it odd that you have said that GotG is a "risk" for Marvel, while at other times saying they have gotten to the point that they can endure one flop. Isn't this a contradiction?  In my opinion, real risk was Lucas creating a whole Galaxy and somehow making it work. And John has compared Feige to Lucas and there's no way that comparison is apt. Feige created nothing and doesn't have the personal or professional risks that Lucas had back in the day.

 

Michael Cluff writes: Dear AMC movie talkers, I love the show and watch it everyday. I noticed you guys try to censor yourself on the show. I watch the show because I am a movie DORK and as a movie dork. I’m sure that others who watch the show are movie dorks too, and as dorks, we've definitely seen R rated films that have profanity. Is there someone higher up who tells you guys to keep it clean, or is it just a decision made by you guys? 

 

Ralph Terry writes: Hello AMC Movie Talk.  I wanted to ask that since Marvel Studios is a full fledged film studio, do you think they will ever make movies that are non-comic book related?  Keep up the good work.

 

Gary M writes: I LOVE THE SHOW and keep up the awesome job. My question is in regards to the Transformers franchise. Why doesn't Michael Bay make the story more Robot Centric versus to Overtly Human. I understand that Humans play a part in the Transformers history, but sometimes I feel as if they take up too much time hogging the screen. I want to see more Robots fighting robots, no sappy love stories. Thank you and bring on the filthy!

 

Darren Schaefer writes: Hi guys long time viewer and fan if the show. My question is what happen to the movie Welcome to Yesterday? I seen preview after preview for months and on opening weekend it just disappeared. Do any of you know what happen to it? Thank you for your time and keep up the great work.

 

Tex The Slayer writes: Hey guys. What are the chances that we get a new He-man movie? He's got a epic redesign in comics and his current tone and over all feeling would work well on the big screen. The current comics feel a lot like the way Krypton felt in the MOS Movie. He's even got a updated costume. What do you guys think? 

 

Harry Dell writes: I love you all and love the show. My question is do you think Disney will be interested in making a movie based on the story of George Lucas during the time he was creating, filming, and finally presenting and shocking the world with the movie Star Wars?

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Could CW's FLASH Be In The JUSTICE LEAGUE Movie?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday June 8th 2014) we take the following viewer email questions:

 

Pablo writes: Hey guys, I love the show. My question is: if movie rights from other studios reverse to Marvel Studios, can they still use the same actors that played an specific character. For example: let's say Spider-Man goes back to Marvel, could they still use Andrew Garfield as Spider-Man?

 

Nicco Caruso writes: My question has to do with the casual audience understanding the Batman reboot. Since TDKR is still fresh in people's minds do you think that the writers and directors of BvS will try to change Batman's backstory a little to help the casual audience understand this isn't a sequel to TDKR? The new Batman's cosmetics have changed drastically but should his backstory also change to help settle the confusion?

 

Melvin Banegas writes: Hello, amc movie talk! love the show, keep up the good work. My question is regarding who should replace Edgar Wright for the ant-man film. With all the directors that have been listed as possibilities to replace Edgar Wright, why hasn't co-writer joe cornish been considered to direct ant-man? He directed 2011's "attack the block", which I loved, does joe cornish not want to direct ant-man?

 

Brian Lynden Johnston writes: There hasn't been much news coverage regarding the development of the 2015 Man From Uncle movie. I was wondering if you guys are looking forward to this movie or not? I noticed it's classified as an action/adventure/COMEDY on some sites.. This does worry me because I enjoyed the original series and it definitely wasn't a comedy. I'm just hoping it doesn't turn out like Starsky and Hutch (2004).

 

Albert Vink writes: Recently you mentioned that the possibility exists that we will see Oliver Queen make an appearance in Batman v. Superman as a contributing billionaire, but not as Green Arrow and not the CW version. With the Flash spin-off series on its way, what will the approach be for the inclusion of the Flash in the Justice League movie? Will they continue with the CW's approach or reintroduce the Flash?

 

Dejan Borjanovic writes: As an avid fan of the show (and as one who worships at the alter of the great and divine god Campea), I was wondering how can fans of the show get one of those badass, kickass Sons of AMC t-shirts? Where can we go if we want to purchase them? I want to wear my love of AMC movie talk loud and proud through the streets of Chicago! 

 

Jay Nolan-Wallace writes: My question is why do marvel films have 3-4 movies a year when dc films has a movie once a year? Keep on the filthy!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - BATMAN V SUPERMAN In 2015? When Should A Movie Get A Perfect 10?
item.description:
In this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday June 7th 2014) we take the following viewer emails:

 

Jesse Hernandez writes: Hey amc movie crew! You guys have been doing a phenomenal job keep up the great work! My question is, is there a movie at the end that made you shed a tear or made you have an emotional moment? Mine was by far Schindler's List Ending With Liam Neeson, What is yours?

 

Bernie Palafox writes: He guys love the show keep up the amazing work. My question is this do you think that Dawn of Justice will have a chance of being released in 2015 instead of 2016 because from the rumors and details filming has begun and  i believe it wouldn't take long to finish this film. Plus if it does get released 2015 it could very will become the greatest year for comic book movies.

 

Raz Abrahamyan writes: Hi Guys, love the show! I was wondering on how you decide for yourself whether a movie is a perfect 10 or not. Say if you've absolutely loved a certain movie, does that mean its a 10? Does it depend on the genre as well? Thanks and keep up the good work!

 

Kevin writes: Hey guys love the show you guys rock! My question is due (history being changed) is it possible that wolverine won't have adamantium in the beginning of X-men apocalypse and is given adamantium by Apocalypse when he makes him Death who is one of the four horsemen like in the comics?

 

Wiggins Terrence writes: Question: I really like the way the Marvel Cinematic Universe has come together and continues to expand beyond Phase 1, Phase 2 and now Phase 3.  John, do you think that the Marvel Cinematic Universe is at the same level of respect and recognition of what the Star Wars franchise did in the late 70's early 80's with Episodes IV, V, and VI? Thoughts?

 

Nick Burlingham writes: I was wondering if you think it is OK for a director to recut a film many years later after its initial release which changes the story or characters in the film from what we know and love.  I know that directors use the excuse that due to better technology or a bigger budget they are releasing the movie that they wanted to make in the first place but I think they should respect their original work and leave as is.

 

Joe Johnson writes: Hello AMC Movie Talkers. I really enjoy watching the show everyday and I think you guys are doing a great job. My question is about the new Beauty and the Beast remake from Disney. I have always thought that if Disney remade Beauty and the Beast that Anne Hathaway would be the perfect Belle. What do you guys think about this and if not Anne Hathaway, who would you want to play Belle. Thanks and keep up the great work!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Are Marvel Movies Better Than DC Movies? A Bret Hart Biopic?
item.description:
On this installment of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday May 18th 2014) John Campea and Jon Schnepp take the following viewer emails:

Jasemine Jackson writes: Hey there sons and daughters of AMC! Love the show; the only place I go for my movie news! I would like to ask something along the lines about AMC rather than films. We fans are very vocal about our opinions and concerns when it comes to the movies we watch (especially within the geek community), and I was wondering if you all ever thought of bringing in a fan to talk with you all on your live broadcastings.

Bryan Bruner writes: Hello amc, I've noticed that people don't seem to enjoy the DC movies quite as much. Personally I loved the dark knight trilogy. And the man of steel, their movies are a lot more darker and serious, while MARVEL has a little to much comedy. I just wanted to know why do you think people enjoy MARVEL movies more than DC?

Ben Zepp writes: I was wondering why Marvel did not shoot and release Ant Man before Age on Ultron and use part of Ant Man as a tool to show the more traditional well known origin of Ultron that Hank Pym creates. Thank you very much for your time.

jordan curet writes: Hey everyone at AMCMovietalk just wanted to say you guys rock first off. I'm a huge fan of the show and I've been watch for since the beginning of this year, So my question is what do you guys think of the new movie coming out The Hundred Foot Journey. I love cooking movies and this one looks really awesome. Just wondering, thanks for the great show and keep bringing the filthy!

Joe Meade writes: You truly are the best damn movie news show on the internet! Been watching since the beginning! My question is if you've heard anything about a Bret Hart biopic based off his book and his documentaries? He was my hero growing up and I believe his story would make a great movie. Also would you want this to happen?

Holly writes: I had a question regarding movie review embargoes. The Fault in Our Stars has been giving advanced screenings to critics and fans the last couple weeks, so I went online, figuring I could read a few reviews, only to discover that reviews had been embargoed until the day of the movie's release. I know plenty of movies place embargo dates on reviews, but still allow reviews to be released a couple weeks ahead of the movie to generate positive buzz. So my question is: if a studio decides to embargo reviews until just a few days before / the day of the movie's release, is that an indicator of the movie's quality? (i.e., does that mean the studio thinks the movie isn't going to be well received and wants to minimize the damage done by negative reviews coming out too early?).

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Could Next X-Men Villain Be Onslaught?
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday May 17th 2014) John Campea and Jon Schnepp take the following viewer questions:

 

Evan Williams writes: Hey guys love the show! I've been with you since the man of steel review and I've been hooked ever since. my question is do you think that batman vs superman will be like amazing Spider-Man 2 over crowding villains but with heroes? I think the movie will be good without Wonder Woman and cyborg (victor viggleston or whatever his name is) when I think about it it's not a lot of guys but then again it is. and if as john says they'll probably play a small part I might be ok but what do you think.

 

Ryan Hubeny writes: Hey all of AMC crew, love your show! I was wondering do you by chance think its possible for a Scooby Doo remake or reboot. Thanks and keep bringing the filthy!

 

No Name write: Greeting and salutations AMC warriors, I love the show and watch your movie talks everyday. My question to you is, is Dwayne Johnson's secret DC character Shazam? He fits all three characteristics Dwayne Johnson said in an interview. #1. He's complex and has a lot going on #2. His powers are on par with Superman and #3. He's pretty well known. What'd you guys think and love the show keep up the amazing work.

 

Marco Tulio Zahn writes: Hi amc movie talk. I'm a huge fan of star trek and was wondering if u guys think it is possible for us to see some next generation stuff in the third installment of the rebooted star trek movie franchise. They could even cast Tom Hardy for the role of younger Cap. Jean-Luc Piccard since he has kinda played this role in Star Trek Nemesis.

 

Jason Ounpraseuth writes: Hey AMC! I wanted to know what the term "in talks" means. I usually see that said when a director or actor is mentioned for a movie. How much of a percentage does that term guarantee that a director/actor is signed on to the project?

 

 

Daniel writes: Hey guys, watch your show religiously. Keep up the great work. My question is since they already announced Apocalypse as the next x-men movie, don't you think it's a little too quick to bring a villain such like him into the franchise; I mean he's apocalypse the top bad guy in the x-men saga who do you think could top him? I was maybe thinking Onslaught, what do you guys think? Thanks and bring the filthy!

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Can Cyclops Return In X-Men? Austin Powers 4
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Sunday May 11th 2014) we address the following viewer email questions:

 

Eric Broomes writes: I am a big fan of you guys. I watch the show everyday. You were talking about cyclops and I was wondering  if they didn't show cyclops dying because they would use him for other films? Like X-Men: Apocalypse which if you read the comic was on the side of apocalypse. Could we see something like that as a end credit teaser for Days of Future Past? Thanks and bring on the filthy.

 

Rob Lunde writes: Do you think the opening weekend box office of "X-Men: Days of Future Past" will be affected negatively by the Bryan Singer controversy?  I myself tend to think no, as he's a director, not a star of the film.  Also, do you think a strong second weekend for "Godzilla" could prevent it from reaching the $125M opening weekend number that the studio is expecting?

 

Nathaniel Scott writes: When a movie gets made, we know the studio has a production budget and an additional marketing budget, so why not re-market classic or modern great films (eg. Star Wars original saga, Gladiator, The Godfather), using a regular production budget but having no production cost. There is already positive hype and word of mouth, and with a full scale marketing campaign, surely the studio could make a lot of money and please the fans. I'd love to see some classics back on the big screen! I know this is done occasionally but why not more often?

 

Nick Vurva writes: With Andy Serkis's Ceaser having a major role and a big speaking part in the upcoming Apes movie, will it be possible for him to finally get nominated for an Oscar?

 

Austin Valdez writes: Hey AMC, my question for you guys is: So we've heard that we will be getting a Mrs. Doubtfire sequel and a Beverly Hills cop IV. I can't seem to get excited for these movies due to the long hiatus they have been on. For some reason though, I wouldn't mind an Austin Powers 4. I think it would do better at the box office than any of these two movies. What do you guys think? Thanks guys! You rule.

 

 

Warren Hood writes: My question is about production budgets.  I'd like to know what are the biggest reasons certain films budgets are so high.  Beyond the obvious(heavy CGI, Talent Salaries, locations etc.) One example might be White house Down and Olympus has fallen, 150m versus 70m.  Is this attributed solely to Jamie Foxx and Channing Tatum's quotes?  I'm just curious how some movies budgets are so vastly different.

item.title: AMC Mail Bag - Options For J. Jonah Jameson, To Drink Or Not To Drink
item.description:
On this episode of AMC Mail Bag (Saturday May 10th 2014) we take the following viewer questions:

 

Thomas Paterson writes: Hey AMC Movie Crew! You guys rock! Anyway, onto my question. I really loved THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 but it appears that it isn't getting the billion-dollar reaction SONY was hoping for. Do you think SONY is so dedicated to its universe it'll go through with it despite looking like the film might break $800 million and that's it? Thanks and bring on the filthy!

 

Colen Peters writes: Hey, I'm a HUGE fan of the show! My question is regarding the future of Steve Rogers as Captain America now that both Crossbones and Sharon Carter have been introduced in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Both of these characters have a connection with the assassination of Captain America during the Civil War story arc. Could the Marvel cinematic universe be headed in that direction? And if Steve Rogers is killed off could Sebastian Stan as Bucky take over the role of Cap like he does in the comics? 

 

Psycho Gorilla writes: Hey, AMC! I'm a big fan of the show and I watch it every day. Do you think or have you heard if we were ever going to get a Tremors reboot, remake or sequel? I think the first movie was great and the sequels were just good, cheesy fun and I think there are still some fun stories that could be told with these creatures along with both new and returning characters. What do you all think?

 

William Morris writes: Hail AMC! Found you guys last year on your Man of Steel review and have been watching ever since. Speaking of reviews, I heard a rumor that John didn't let Schnepp do the review of The Amazing Spider-Man 2 because he didn't like the film. Is this true? If so, how do you decide what films to review and who reviews them?

 

Jarod Wilson writes: Hey guys, first I want to say you guys are great and Jon Schnepp you are hilarious. In movies, are the actors really drinking alcohol beverages, or is it juice/soda in the scenes? Thanks and bring on the filthy!

 

 

Jacob Parker writes: Discovered AMC Movie talk about 2 months ago and haven't missed a show since, keep up the great work. I was wondering in the spirit of comic book characters no longer being restricted to race casting if you think Keith David would make a good Jameson? I personally think he'd be terrific, I loved him in Something about Mary, Men at Work and Armageddon among others.
